item.title: How do I make ::banker
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:4, topic:413748”] if ((command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank") && (playerRights == 5)) { openBank();//OR whatever your method is, just find clicking on a banker }

@matzie… playerRights == 5 does not necessarily mean that they have admin powers if the admin commands are done properly, for example:

if (playerRights == 2 || playerRights == 3) {
[/code][/quote]

[code]switch (playerRights) {
case 3

break
case 2

break
case 1

case 0//default

}

thats how i set mine up =3

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make ::banker
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

if ((command.equalsIgnoreCase("bank") && (playerRights == 5)) {
        openBank();//OR whatever your method is, just find clicking on a banker
}

@matzie… playerRights == 5 does not necessarily mean that they have admin powers if the admin commands are done properly, for example:

if (playerRights == 2 || playerRights == 3) {

Read full topic

item.title: How do I make ::banker
item.dc:creator: @ImmensePK ImmensePK
item.description:
@ImmensePK wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:2, topic:413748”]ok first off.

  1. source??
  2. what the hell do you mean? what banker does it use? any banker around? does it spawn a banker? does the banker disappear when they log out? can anyone use the banker? can the banker be only visible to them?(i dont know how do to that but its possible…) why do you make their player rights higher rather than adding a donator rights?

giving them player rights means they are at more power than owners.[/quote]

It depends, he may have all of his owner commands set to playerName instead of playerRights alot of people have super donor status on their server’s these days.

Read full topic
